ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: You cover the entirety of Machado de Assis's career and nothing else, if this doesn't appeal, don't take it. But if you're interested in South American literature at all it, it will be very helpful and interesting.

I would recommend the course if you're interested in character psychology. We dedicated a lot of seminar time to discussing the overarching psychological framework of each novel, which really forced us to become parts of the novels ourselves. There's a great deal of historical context to be understood in all of the reading, so a knowledge of nineteenth-century Brazilian history helps. The workload is low - three papers and a short-answer take-home final exam. Not much more that you could ask from a literature seminar.
Lots of reading, lots of writing, lots of fun.
